jobDescription: Why Provident Provident Credit Union is member-owned, trusted, financially sound, technologically advanced, and provides "world class" value, convenience, products and services to all members. We are headquartered in Redwood Shores, CA and have 18 branches located throughout the San Francisco Bay Area, and Folsom. Primary Function The position is responsible for facilitating research, planning and completion of tasks with stakeholders to ensure the integrity and security of the credit union’s systems and information assets. The position must document, improve, maintain and support the credit union’s cyber security strategy. The position will work with end users to determine the security needs of all departments, and will implement policies and procedures that result in full IT security compliance throughout the organization. The position is also responsible for auditing our security vendors, and ensuring we have capable and available resources to respond to situations that require heightened security services. DutiesWork with Credit Union Staff to recognize and mitigate potential, successful and unsuccessful intrusion attempts and compromises through reviews and analysis of relevant detail and summary information.Plan, scope and drive security projects including but not limited to virus prevention and remediation; intrusion detection prevention and remediation; log analysis, network security improvements; security scans, audits and relevant remediation.Maintain the Credit Union's FFIEC CAT (Cyber Security Assessment Tool)Audit and updating the annual IT risk assessmentDocument and update management responses to third party security audits and assessmentsComplete security review requests within published timeframesResearch and recommend security solutionsStay abreast of compliance, regulatory and security practices, issues and technologiesMonthly audit of hardware, software and network connectivity inventory, access management and harding of systems, network devices and connectivityValidate that security patches have been implemented in a timely and effective mannerAdhere to change management policy and procedures for security changesCollaborate with the Training Department to ensure the Credit Union's Security Awareness Program is comprehensive and relevantProvide input to technology and security policies, procedures and budgetSalary Range: The salary range for this position is between $68,900 & $87,900.
